website_summaries.verdict: A multi-purpose, manual grinder/mincer/pasta maker that requires time and effort.
pros: Easy to take apart and clean
Also a mincer and pasta maker
cons: Grinding handle requires a fair amount of force
Multiple small parts require careful storage

customer_reviews.title: The old model is much better. This one sucks.
customer_reviews.text: The old model is much better and stronger. I bought an old model in 2015's August from Amazon and used it as a meat grinder. It works perfectly. Three days ago I purchased the same product for my parents. When I tried to use it the first time, the plastic part just cracked. As you can see from the images, the new is a little bigger than the old model and the plastic is much weaker. I cannot understand why the manufacturer upgrades the old model. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT AS A MEAT GRINDER
customer_reviews.author: QZ

customer_reviews.title: Lovely kitchen item, recommend !
customer_reviews.text: I’m in love with this little grinder now! I made 3 times of sausage and two times of meet grinding. Pork shoulder was easy to grind. Lamb leg meat was also easy to grind. Also the chicken leg meat. Garlic clove was stuck on the machine and not easy to use. Celery is also not easy to use. Steamed carrots... of course easy as a pie. So , it’s for meat grinding, not for vegetables. Still. Strongly recommend! It’s easy to use assembling and cleaning. It comes with several pasta making parts but I didn’t try yet.
customer_reviews.author: XIANGLAN CUI

customer_reviews.title: Small, simple and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier version of this grinder, but, unfortunately, had lost its knife. A replacement knife would have cost me (with S/H) almost the same as buying a new one, and that's what I did. Compared to the old one, this one is a bit bigger, has a few additional pasta making extensions (which I don't use). I use it for grinding meat and it is perfect for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Broke on Third Use
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is a great design, except for one thing. The third time I used it there was a little gristle in the meat I was grinding that required a bit more pressure on the handle. I heard a cracking sound and realized the hopper had completely broken in two. The replacement parts for this unit cost almost as much as the unit itself. So now I have a piece of junk. The only reason I'm giving it two stars instead of one is that it would have been a great design without this major flaw. I would say, look elsewhere until they fix this problem.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice, simple
customer_reviews.text: Nice, simple, and easy to clean. Biggest issue with this product is the suction cup at the bottom. If you don't have a clean, non-porous or curved counter or table edge to place it in, then the suction cup won't hold. This is the biggest issue I came across with this. You need to have it at the edge because the crank is longer than the main body. However, even with a clean edge, the suction cup did not hold on it's own when pressure was applied during the cranking motion. You'll have to secure it by putting pressure at the top of the meat holder, which is not really meant to be done, but you'll have very little choice.
customer_reviews.author: A. Marte

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this piece of trash!!!!
customer_reviews.text: No point. I was able to do nice soft chicken thighs, but the minute I put in some cut up chuck, it broke. I thought maybe I did something wrong and ordered it YET AGAIN, as I still had most of the parts. Same thing. Within 30 minutes, the plastic casing blew out and broke. Cheap piece of crap that I have now spent $40 on where I could've just spent that on a METAL processor, and oh, no way to reach out to company to even complain, so here's my platform. DON'T BUY THIS GARBAGE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Works great on perfect meat--too much trouble for meat with fiber
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it was with beautiful London Broil steak. Perfect meat through and through. The machine worked perfectly. Then I bought stew beef to grind. The machine clogged time and time again. Very frustrating! This was not ugly meat--just had some very small fibrous white parts. Had to take the machine apart every few minutes. When it clogged it kept grinding the meat--it just wouldn't push it out of the machine, so it turned the beef into a grind so fine it was almost a paste. I will keep it in case there is another sale on steak--but would never use it again on chuck or other cuts that are less than perfect.
customer_reviews.author: N. M.

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: This is not the best grinder in the world, and I suspect that I might very much like a metal grinder. But I wanted something lightweight and compact so that I would use it often. Easy to clean would be nice also. The Norpro meat grinder is absolutely perfect for small batches (up to a kg). We decided to stop buying any pre-ground meat, so when we want sausage or burgers we use the Norpro. It took a few tries to get the fat content right, but the flavor and texture are great. The unit is easy to clean and store. I treat it a bit delicately--it is made of plastic--but for quick use and the price, its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: R. Apte

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: We only use it for grinding fish, is really easy to use, good price. The suction cup doesn’t work very well but it gets the job done. Compact, I like that is easy to clean and uses little space for storage.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a delight. I have never owned a mean grinder and i am an old guy. Wow. I only grind about one pound a time, which takes maybe three minutes. Fantastic value; the screen with the small holes is best. Beautifully made. Fit and finish A+. Chuck, lamb leg,all good. You do not need the vacuum. Easy to simply hold it with one hand and turn the crank with the other. If it was dish washer safe, that would be great. Clean up takes longer than grinding, but is not hard. I put all the pieces in the meat tray and cover with wrap for storage and to keep the pieces together.
customer_reviews.author: serious-buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder, great price
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this a few weeks ago. I wanted something to grind up liver to hide in meatloaf and for cuts of pork and chicken for ground versions. It's pretty freaking sweet. I will never use it for the pasta aspect, but I just ground up a pound of beef liver in no time flat. It turned easily, stuck firmly to the countertop, and ground 99% of it with nearly nothing left in the push screw chamber. I'm excited to try chicken and pork in it, or even sausage. I can mince the garlic, onion, and herbs right into the meat, too. For the price, it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: DiscoB

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this now for several months. I use it only to grind meat, have not used any of the other attachments. I make my own cat food and ground about 12 lbs at a time, it has worked great for me and has been a huge time saver. I have NOT tried grinding any bones but it does well for meat, skin, tendons, organs.
customer_reviews.author: B.E.

customer_reviews.title: Broke first use; worthless, dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, poorly designed. The whole thing feels like it's ripping itself apart every time you turn the handle (and it is!). Broke on first use grinding meat, while following instructions- it was not over loaded and it was assembled correctly, it's just garbage. The end of the plastic threading completely cracked off within a minute, leaving me with a mess and inedible meat with plastic shards in it. While cleaning it up, I noticed that the main grinding screw itself was scraping even more plastic off of the bottom of the cylinder. Who doesn't like plastic shavings in their food? Save the time and money.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: This Grinder really works !!
customer_reviews.text: As others have said...to look at this grinder of mostly plastic you'd never think it could do what it Can do. So far I've ground two chuck roasts into hamburger meat with ease. I followed recommendations of other reviews and cut the roast into pieces and went slow and steady. If it seemed to be bogging down, I backed it off, rearranged the pieces and continued on. And it's a breeze to clean up and store, in the original box, till it's needed again
customer_reviews.author: William Gearing

customer_reviews.title: buy if you like to eat plastic
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for a year and a half, I loved it until today. I have used this less than ten times and today, I notice pieces of plastic broke off the top of the hole that the meat is forced through, so now I am thinking, did this happen in the past as meat was forced through and have I consumed plastic? now I cannot bear the though and it will go in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: FuzzyDice

customer_reviews.title: I only wish it had lasted.
customer_reviews.text: It was good while it lasted. I remain convinced that I can make a better breakfast sausage, and better ground beef by grinding my own meat. However it will not happen with this grinder because the hopper split in half while grinding my most recent attempt at grinding pork. This was the 2nd time I had used it for grinding meat. I used it once for pasta. Pity,
customer_reviews.author: S. Alberts

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This was a decent product for the price. It comes with everything you need. On my first one, the plastic broke and I returned it. I received my second one and its been working great. You cant put too much of a load on it because it can get damaged. But for the price, its a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzie

customer_reviews.title: Did not like it
customer_reviews.text: This product is okay for the money. I have used this product not more than 15 times in a year and yesterday it was cracked while I was making ground beef.
customer_reviews.author: batuhan

customer_reviews.title: So let me start off by saying it worked great twice. Ground up some burger meat
customer_reviews.text: So let me start off by saying it worked great twice. Ground up some burger meat. But yesterday I used it and I cut the chuck into small cubes. However, while grinding through a piece of fat on the meat, that fat must have wedged between the auger and the housing and the housing cracked. I'm not terribly upset, but I'm certainly in the market for an actual meat grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Sascha Gast

customer_reviews.title: Ok meat grinder, but horrible pasta maker.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder/ pasta maker has a lot of potential, but there are some serious design flaws. First, there's no way that it can work as a pasta maker because of the way that the dough comes out. Because of the circle shape the dough sticks together and is unusable. Secondly, the handle is much longer than the machine, which eliminates the convenience of the no clamp design. Third, the spaghetti attachment makes the noodles way to big so even if they didn't stick together they would be the biggest noodles you ever saw. Finally, the suction cup bottom is not strong enough to hold the machine in place for the entire duration of use.
customer_reviews.author: Justin E. Dibler

customer_reviews.title: don't buy for pasta making!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for making homemade pasta and it was a disaster! I followed the recipe that comes with the product and all I got was frustrated and a big mess to clean up. The spaghetti attachment clumps the pasta as it comes through and the dough sticks together. I tried adding more flour and that didn't fix the problem. I plan to try different recipes in the future but be warned that the recipe that comes with it does not turn out well and the attachment is poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a meat grinder. Works well but, the sausage attachment is not useful. If looking to stuff sausages, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this specifically to make small amounts of meat sausage. I have used it to make beef sausage with onion and garlic. It has worked very well for my small batches. YOU MUST partially freeze the food prior to grinding. It would be 5 stars, however the sausage tube attachment did not work well. I did not need it as I was utilizing large casings that I stuffed myself and this has been my method. However, if purchasing to make smaller sausages that need filled, I would look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Nern

customer_reviews.title: Used it maybe 5 times total, each time grinding ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it maybe 5 times total, each time grinding pieces of pork or beef. It broke in the middle of my grinding job (~2lbs of meat). See the photograph.
customer_reviews.author: HonestReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this little grinder to do cooked chicken, carrots and celery from soup so that it makes the foods easier to digest. I am following the SCD diet and thought this would help. I did a second batch yesterday and it worked like a charm. I have not yet tried it for ham salad or to grind raw meats. In light of hearing about the PINK SLIME in some ground meats I will be grinding beef the next time I want to make meatloaf or spaghetti sauce. It is easy to clean and stores in the plastic bowl that comes with it to catch the food as it grinds. Love this little work horse.
customer_reviews.author: MomMcDuck

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Just used it for the first time and it was so easy! Made our own ground chicken breast and it worked beautifully. Easy to turn, great suction on the countertop, and super easy to clean! What more could you ask for? Looking forward to grinding all our own meat and knowing exactly what goes into it. Might also save a little money, the chicken breast was .99¢ lb., including skin and bones, but still much cheaper than ground chicken breast ($3-3.50 ish lb.) even after trimming. Great gadget, wished I would have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 6 lbs of sausage the first time with no problem
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make deer sausage for the first time and it worked great. The suction mechanism is awesome on granite counter and no way was it going to release. The grinding mechanism was smooth and I ground 6 pounds in probably 15-20 minutes with little effort. The clean up is easy in the sink with hot soapy water. For the cost I don't see how you can go wrong. Why pay for an expensive kitchen aid attachment unless you are making 30 pounds. For the every now and then use I would recommend this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: Great hand crank grinder
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy hard plastic. Easy to put together and to use. I've grinded chicken and steak meat and it's worked great except for the silver fat on the chicken and steak gets stuck and you have to clean out the grinder. If the meats too slippery I freeze it for a bit and cut it into chunks and it grinds perfectly. I usually cut off the fat then grind the meat and it works like a charm. It's easy to clean and dry no complaints. For the price and size it's definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't meet my expectations. Doesn't bring meat, tears it. This is just one example of a product being not as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Nikita

customer_reviews.title: Chopper?
customer_reviews.text: Well, I bought this to chop meat for my small dogs. It takes too much time to try and push it through the top of the grinder with the plastic piece they provide. Ended up using my fingers (very carefully). In fact it slips while you are trying to turn the handle to initiate the grinding process. . It came out in too small of pieces anyway. May be okay for pasta. Good luck as that will require you to push the dough through with your fingers also. Don't waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Nice small grinder and stuffer.
customer_reviews.text: Just the tool for small 1 to 2 lbs batches of sausage. The small blade is a little too coarse for breakfast sausage. Good for a stuffed sausage like Polish and Italian. I don't expect it to last too long. I have made only about 6 lbs so far. No issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: ChetGmail

customer_reviews.title: My first meat grinder, works well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this meat for my girlfriend based on the good reviews. We both like it. The parts are high quality. She uses it mainly to grind chicken and turkey meats. It's easy to assemble, use, and clean. I'm a little worried about it holding up to tough meat or hard cheese or whatever. However, we currently don't have any gnarly jobs planned for it. I'm glad I didn't buy a grinder that has a motor. I figure a good motor for these things needs to be at least $200. We're not that serious about our grinding tasks.
customer_reviews.author: biirb

customer_reviews.title: Poor... Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: While it works fine... It's not the product in the first picture. Look at the second and third picture and see the difference in color. My guess is that it's an older model with less attachments. The whole reason I bought this was for the fusili pasta. And it doesn't come with that attachment even though it's shown in the first picture. It only came with meat grinders and three pasta attachments. Very disappointed. But I didn't want to deal with the hassle of returning it. Be sure to look really hard at other products before gambling on this. Oh, and the square bowl for the meat came in cracked.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Loos

customer_reviews.title: Give me that ole time religion!
customer_reviews.text: It's too light duty and delicate. Cannot even grind a variety of nuts with it -- English walnuts, cashews, pistachio, pecans -- without alternately cranking the handle forward then backward; afraid that it will easily break otherwise -- a half turn to one and a half turns in each direction -- and using the coarsest blade. I'd rather have one of the old entirely metal meat grinders -- the grinders of my grandmothers -- that ground any nuts easily, circa the 1950s-1960s. Now those were grinders! Strong; lasted forever; and ground just about anything.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Borda

customer_reviews.title: I do not like plastic shavings in my food
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to use this product for the first time the metal plate cut into the plastic housing and produced plastic shavings. In my food. I do not like plastic shavings in my food. I thought perhaps it failed because I hadn't tightened it down enough, so I tried to tighten it and the cap broke off. This seems to be very poor workmanship. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: michael g brown

customer_reviews.title: they loved it. They use it all the time now ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents, they loved it. They use it all the time now to grind small amounts of pork and chicken meat. They have also recommended it to many of their friends. And for how much it costs, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: I-am-Q

customer_reviews.title: Is an excellent buy!
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is durable and easy to use . I was skeptical of how easy it would be to use, given its low price. Typically when I buy a less expensive gadget, it has more pieces to assemble, and it is more apt to rust out. But this grinder really is made of quality materials that have not degraded, and ...if you spend a few minutes to read through the directions, it is as easy to use as can be. I have used it to make pasta , and also to grind a steak into meat for hamburger. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: R.R

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive, simple to assemble, works as advertised meat grinder works great, we have begun purchasing our own beef and grinding it into hamburger and this Norpro works perfectly. There is just the two of us at home now, for our purposes it works great. Recommend for those who have been considering their own grinding.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Easy-to-Clean Meat Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have used this grinder for over a year now. It continues to perform flawlessly. It replaced both a very hard to clean old-style metal hand grinder, and my Mom's 1960's RIVAL small hand grinder. The NORPRO is super easy to clean. The blade and die are stainless - no rust like on both my others. It is used exclusively to grind meat - mostly Chuck Roasts when on sale to make pink-slime-free burgers and meatloaf. Makes a great Gift, too.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe how well it works for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second season using it, and it's went through 20lb of venison in no time... start to finish (from huge bowl of meat bits to wrapped and in the freezer) was about 40-45 minutes. Not bad for $25 bucks! I will say that it's a bit hard to use for large amounts of sausage (hence the only 4 stars), but to be honest so are most things that aren't an actual press. If you're going to make sausage make sure your mix is cold-cold-cold to facilitate the stuffing. Haven't used it for pasta yet, so no feedback there.
customer_reviews.author: MewnBeam

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and compact in its size. I bought this to grin meat for making dumplings. It works. Saves us a lot of time and efforts. I have also used it to grin peanuts; it works as well. Although you shouldn't put too many peanuts at one time. Very well designed. I like how it is locked to the counter -- without bolts/nuts, just turn the triangle shaped button using the key provided. I also like their design that the key is used to help pressing meat/peanuts into the grinder.
customer_reviews.author: summer

customer_reviews.title: and it's so easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I'm obsessed with this grinder. I use it for my cat's raw food diet to grind up raw chicken, including bone and skin, and it's so easy to assemble, disassemble and clean! I always worry that it might break when I'm grinding bone, but it's held up through 2 big batches so far, and it was, of course, much cheaper than an electric grinder. As a college student on a budget just trying to do right by my cat, I am so happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Young

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a little grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little grinder for the price! I purchased this so that I could grind up the leftover ham I cooked for Thanksgiving (about 5 pounds of ham)to make shepherds pie and add a little ground up ham to my hashbrowns in the morning and it worked flawlessly. I also plan on using it to grind up the leftover roast pork that I frequently cook. I'm giving it four stars because I've only used it once, so time will tell if it holds up. If it does I'll update my review. It's also very easy to take apart and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Robitaille

customer_reviews.title: Great Mincer for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was tired of trying to chop my cat's chicken small enough to suit their desires. Yes, I know - scheesh! - for a cat??!!. Yes, they are quite old and pampered. This is GREAT and does a great job of grinding it up in to tiny morsels. My only complaint is the handle is longer than the main body forcing me to place it next to an edge of the counter. That can be awkward for the turning process and placement of the bowl. For the money this is a great little mincer, though!!
customer_reviews.author: CatmomMarcia

customer_reviews.title: Good falafel grinder 😆
customer_reviews.text: Never worked with it for meat I guessd it’s not for meat but I actually using it to make the falafel it works good although it needs effort otherwise the grinder good product
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Amazling little tool
customer_reviews.text: Simply works great. Sturdy, exceptional quality material, secure suction base, very easy to assemble for quick use and to disassemble for quick cleaning. The most positive thing I appreciated is the fact that the cup where you place and grind the food is transparent. To me, it is important when cleaning to be able to actually see inside where the food was grounded and assure no residues are left on parts surfaces assuring safe, sterile cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Charly'smama

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this after reading about pink slime. We have now used it to grind all our meat. We have made: meatballs, pork soup dumplings, chicken burgers, and even the pasta (though the pasta is good, its quite hardy! seems great for soups). We didn't have any of the troubles that others have had. We always trim most if not all of the fat we can before running it through the machine and I love that it washes so easily. For our family of 4, it works great! I would totally recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Skiesshadedred

customer_reviews.title: WORKS AS PROMISED
customer_reviews.text: When buying this product don't expect to get a super gadget. This is a Hyundai compared to a Cadillac. But don't be fooled either, it surely does it's job. It's nearly impossible to get ground beef here in Japan. I buy a fresh cut of beef, cut it in cubes and crank the machine to make wonderful ground hamburger. Haven't used it for anything else yet. There is a slight problem with the suction cup, but I think that's due to our kitchen counter surface here which is not flat but textured.
customer_reviews.author: WOLF F.

customer_reviews.title: it is wonderful. The counter suction works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: As a grinder, it is wonderful. The counter suction works perfectly. As a pasta maker, it was not fun.....the pasta stuck in it and the dough had to be put through 3 times before it was tough enough to "stand alone"..... I would never use it again for pasta...... Just buy the fresh stuff in the supermarket!
customer_reviews.author: K. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: My wife has wanted this for some time. She was so excited to receive it! IT BROKE the second time she tried to use it. Second crank of the handle and it cracked. Total waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea that you can mince, grind meat, and make pasta, however you put something like pasta it will literally crack over time. This only lasted for two uses before the plastic cracked and completely broke. Very disappointed. This not like I was making a lot of pasta, only 2 cups worth of flour before this cracked.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Bang

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because ground beef prices were too high. We started buying three or four pound chuck or round roasts, and dividing them into one pound packages.We only grind about one pound of beef at a time. It's easiest to grind the meat while it's partially frozen. Our savings are about forty to sixty cents a pound over store packaged ground beef. The meat tastes great, and we know what is in our ground beef, No Pink Slime! Easy to disassemble and re-assemble, clean-up is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Corey J Burke

customer_reviews.title: Great little grinder!
customer_reviews.text: The beef chuck, chicken breast, and pork roast I used in this little whiz of a grinder all came out great. Now I KNOW what's in my ground meats. And I save $$ buying on sale and grinding myself. It's easy to use and clean. One thing: The handle is very long, so hard to position on the edge of the counter. I'M GLAD I BOUGHT IT! Look forward to grinding fresh cranberries at Thanksgiving!
customer_reviews.author: Amiable Cook

customer_reviews.title: looks fragile but works well
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this at first but with the good reviews gave it a try. it worked very well when I first got it and after a while the suction on the bottom didn't work as well but wetting the surface before putting it on solved that. it's easy to take apart and clean. I've ground about 30-40lb of tough london broil steak with this grinder and it was still going strong. I only stopped using it because I could have safeway grind it for me for free.
customer_reviews.author: Garrisonalton

customer_reviews.title: This Little Grinder will get the job done
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I wasn't expecting a lot from this product, since it was the least expensive of all the ones I considered. However, I was delighted at how well it performed. It's well designed from high quality plastic and all the pieces fit together perfectly. I bought it specifically to grind cured ham, which it did quickly and easily. It never clogged and it stayed securely in place on the counter. I would highly recommend this great little grinder, which by the way is made in the good old USA.
customer_reviews.author: Valorie C.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT buy if you plan to mince meat
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy if you plan to use for meat mincing. It did not work as promised. I only tried once to mince pork and instead of mince pork it minced itself with plastic pieces broken off the spiral thing. I wasted not only the grinder but also pork. Very disappointed. And my return window was passed.
customer_reviews.author: bnrocks

customer_reviews.title: Norpro Meat Grinder
customer_reviews.text: The grinder assembled quickly and did a great job of grinding some cooked pork shoulder for Cajun Boudan sausage. Cleaning it was a snap also. Recommend a solid smooth surface for maximum hold. Tried it on a smooth wood counter top, but had better luck on a standard vinyl counter top. I highly recommend this grinder for general use. Have not tried it on and pasta yet.
customer_reviews.author: MAC 10

customer_reviews.title: worthless is not a strong enough word.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst piece of kitchen equipment I have ever owned. I just used it for the second time. It will grind meat, but it will nott stay locked to the counter, and don't even try to make pasta in it. If I knew where to sent it, I would sent it back to the manufacturer and tell them where to stick it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte J. Gray

customer_reviews.title: My first return to Amazon because of poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I am not a complainer, this is the first bad review I have given anything from Amazon. Perhaps this would work well as a pasta maker or to mix play dough, but as a meat grinder it just doesn't work. The very first thing I tried to do was make sausage from pork tenderloin, didn't even cut it. This is also the first return to Amazon because it does not perform.
customer_reviews.author: g

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this meat grinder. It was so easy and effortless to use. Cleaning is a breeze because everything came apart so you can wash it thoroughly. This is a definitely must have kitchen gadget for anyone who loves to cook and make wholesome food.
customer_reviews.author: ChinaWhite

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and does excellent job
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expected much for the price but the reviews I've read were mostly positive. Rightly so. The little thing looks great, easy to use, and easy to clean. I wanted to grind our meat by ourselves rather than buy ready made. My wife said it would have to be me and me alone to do this. Now, because it is actually fun to use it, she wants to do the grinding herself.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Adams

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for grinding meat and it works superbly! I grind up pork picnic with some pork back and this meat is very tough to cut with knife, but it grinds smoothly. I find sometimes with an especially thick piece of meat and fat back that I have to go slower until it starts grinding it through, but she held up. Occasionally I reversed a bit to reposition meat in feeder, but most of the time did not have to. It cleans easy, comes apart easy and stores easy. I am able to grind 10 lbs of dense pork and fat in less than an hour. It took me longer to cut the meat up from the butcher.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Peters

customer_reviews.title: Broke in one day
customer_reviews.text: This grinder seemed to work perfectly at first. After about 5 lbs of grinding a piece of fat got caught in the grinder and broke the plastic that metal plates tightened onto. This caused plastic to break off all in the grinded meat causing us to have to throw all of that meat out as well as throw the grinder away since it was now unusable. Unfortunately even though it seemed like it was good at first in the end it was a waste of 20 dollars that tore up in one day.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany White

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I was excited and after the positive reviews of being easy to clean, stays on your counter top, does not slide - great reviews. It does not stick to my counter top (granite, which is very smooth!), I made pasta (which was delicious) but the pasta dough came out in the front and the back and for cleaning I needed a toothpick to get all the dough out, which is now in the drain... Very painful!
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dime!
customer_reviews.text: My first grinder ever owned and I'm happy happy happy! My 1 year old has no teeth so I bought this so I could grind her chicken pork steak ect. Then cook it in a patty so it will be chewable for her. It does the trick great! Easy to put to gather and take apart so easy too clean also! grips to the counter. Meat goes right threw. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This grinder does exactly what I expected. It is simple to use and cleans up easily. My only complaint is that the grinder's handle is so long (unnecessarily so in my oponion) that the grider can only be used on the edge of a counter. As you can see from the image, the handle is longer than the grinder so if you want to position it anywhere other than the edge of the counter the handle will not turn and the grinder will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Whisper 2

customer_reviews.title: Cute AND Functional!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice solid Lego-like plastic. Works very well on my table. Just know you need to cut out as much of the sinews & ligaments as best you can. If you cut the meat in small pieces it should be fine if you miss any. I've used it for pork, beef and turkey and it works great. It also worked pretty well to chop onion and make bread crumbs for meat patties. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Trelaine

customer_reviews.title: Like to grind my own
customer_reviews.text: The best meat grinder for the price. This little dandy can grind everything and is about $40 to $50 cheaper than most other manual grinders that I've seen on line. Yes it is plastic but the crank is metal and plates and blade are stainless steal. Excellent design - does what it is supposed to do. Down side is that the hopper is small and is only good for small batches of 3 to 5 lbs. Easy to clean. If you are a novice sausage maker and don't want to spend an exorbitant amount of money - this baby is for you.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Really great
customer_reviews.text: You cant beat this product for the price. Perfect for someone like me who only cooks for one or two people at a time. Highly recommended and I will purchase other products from Norpro because of this product.. Only negative thing is the pasta attachments are not very good, especially the spaghetti and the linguine. They are just too small. Update: Still doing good.
customer_reviews.author: vincent mistretta

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: It’s manual so you are going to have to work but for the price it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Versluis

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good actually
customer_reviews.text: Very pleasantly surprised by this device. A looked a little cheap, and somehow I never expected it to work that well. (Apol's to the manufacturer!) But it sticks to my counter top really well, and minces meat. Haven't tried the other things, but it minces lean meat quite well. (Not strong enough for tough or frozen meat, I suspect.)
customer_reviews.author: Andy Alford

customer_reviews.title: probably a really good kitchen item
customer_reviews.text: but it broke the third time I used it to chop the white chocolate bits I use in my cheesecake. the electric ones I've been wearing out last about 6 months so I thought a hand crank would last longer. as I said, for everything else it is probably great. sorry I have it such a tough test. gayle's whitevelvet cheesecake
customer_reviews.author: gayle grant brown

customer_reviews.title: better than expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: For a cheap grinder it works great. You get what you pay for, in this case its a little better than expected. It is easy for one person to use and works quickly. its not as easy as my sisters kitchen aid attachment but it also was ALOT cheaper. The gripper foot works best if you wipe the counter with a damp cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses this to grind up chicken thighs, bones and all, for bobcat food. It sticks to our kitchen smooth counter like it was welded down. I tried the pasta attachment and didn't have much luck on the first attempt. I suppose that might be something that requires practice.
customer_reviews.author: Pete K

customer_reviews.title: Finally Used It Today, love it
customer_reviews.text: I finally used it today! It's so easy to use, not messy at all, easy to crank. Most of the meat goes through the grinder, when i was done using it, not much unground meat in the grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Norpro Meat Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I had to give the Norpro Meat Grinder three stars, not for it's performance, but for the way it was shipped to me. It was packed very loosely in a very large box with a 30 pound printer which broke the plastic container for the grinder. The grinder itself and it's working parts were fine, so I decided not to send it back, because I have other containers that I can use with it.
customer_reviews.author: Love Retirement

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. I used it to grind up potatoes very ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I used it to grind up potatoes very finely and make home made hashbrowns aka potato pancakes that my grandma used to make. It's amazing. It has a suction cup at the bottom that you can engage so you can grind food with as much muscle as you need. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Zingat

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: Grinder works well, it is perfect for small jobs, gives up to 2lb ground meat in less than 5 minutes. Needs some prep work- the meat has to be pre-cut in cubes or longer stripes, but I can't complain. It is perfect for my small kitchen with very limited storage space. It is light and easy to assemble. Easy to clean, but the metal parts has to be well dried before putting away. I did not try it for pasta yet... I warmly recommend this product for anybody who is concerned by the freshness and the quality of ground meats from the grocery stores. The product was shipped next day and arrived faster than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Roro

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and easy to clean. For the price I am quite impressed. I ground down a whole turkey (meat only), pork and a side of beef. This little guy can handle it. The base came up off the counter a couple times, but not enough to be a big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Guilfoyle

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: It's a small and inexpensive thing, and to look at it you wouldn't believe it can handle a real job. I made pasta for the first time in this a couple days after it arrived, not expecting much. Wrong! It's meat grinder is just the ticket when smaller amounts for things such as ravioli filling are needed. Good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Connie N.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandmother who has arthritis in both her hands. She loves this grinder because it's so easy to use. It comes with multiple plates making it very convenient in the kitchen. Also the whole thing comes apart for easy cleaning. The instructions were very class so she can easily put it back together Ayer washing it.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: excellent deal
customer_reviews.text: this is not for a butcher shop - its for those of us with occasional meat grinding projects and not grinding huge amounts or pasta making. This is not for large amounts but for smaller amounts it is ideal - it works exactly as described - it is easy to use and the results are excellent. This is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: drjanem

customer_reviews.title: Very nice one!
customer_reviews.text: I used it multiple times and had zero issues with that! Small but gets its job done like a pro! Dry it nicely before putting it away so it doesn't rust (I mean the metal parts)
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: It is really easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This little grinder grinds up chicken really well. I have not tried it on anything else, but I have had no issues with it. It is really easy to use, and the suction clasp status securely in place throughout the entire process.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C Shronce

customer_reviews.title: Works well for filling sausage casings
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Norpro Meat Grinder primarily for making sausage. I was encouraged by previous reviews plus the additional options for use. It works great for filling sausage casings. Only have had it for 3 days so I don't know about other uses. My only difficulty was lacking personal strength to turn knob to lock grinder in place on counter. Luckily my son came and he did it. It will be a good strength trainer for me as I definitely will make sausage more often.
customer_reviews.author: Sooz

customer_reviews.title: money saver
customer_reviews.text: this is my first grinder and i dont know why ppl are hateing on it i've had mine now for 3 weeks been grinding my own turkey,chicken and hamburger this thing works exactly how it should grinds with ease and being able to take it fully apart makes clean up very easy would really recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: mtfreaky

customer_reviews.title: pff
customer_reviews.text: It works, but was breaking very easily. Make sure to cut meat or such VERY SMALL! Best used if you put a few pieces in at a time.
customer_reviews.author: WalkingGiant

customer_reviews.title: great value. everything comes apart
customer_reviews.text: great value. everything comes apart, so you can just throw it in the dishwasher (in the silverware tray). it is plastic, so you have to cut your meat down a bit. you can't expect to just throw a big chunk of meat in there and use your muscles to get it through.
customer_reviews.author: Shane_FDB

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a industrial grinder this is not it. I use this grinder for making cat food and general kitchen grinding. It works great. I tried it for pasta but went out and got a pasta machine after the second time I tried it. It will do pasta but does not work well like a pasta machine. It cleans up nicely and sticks to the counter very well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Booth

customer_reviews.title: It is an inexpensive and compact grinder
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problem I have with it is that if there is any resistance from what I am trying to grind the thing comes off the counter. It size is great in that it stores in a very small space, but for serious meat grinding I would suggest one that clamps down to the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a toy, but does the job really well. Basically, all parts that do not experience strong mechanical stress are replaced by plastic - a good idea. I especially like the suction concept - it liberates me from damaging the kitchen table in my rental apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Nik

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great little grinder
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great little grinder. I have used it maybe 6 times to getting wheat berries for bread making and also ground chicken breasts to make chicken patties. Great grinder for the money.
customer_reviews.author: DMiller

customer_reviews.title: Not As Happy With as I Thought
customer_reviews.text: I was grinding a roll of meat substitute, so maybe that is why it didn't work as well for me as I thought it would. Have to keep unclogging as I turned the grinder handle. Patience is a virtue here, but I'm glad I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Minnie O. Jones

customer_reviews.title: A Great Lower-Cost Kitchen Appliance
customer_reviews.text: The plastic pieces are simple enough to clean after use. The manual powered appliance is simple to use on a flat kitchen counter top. Grinding beef chuck and pork are simple to do. I only gave 4 stars, because, I could not manage to make a decent pasta after one attempt at making pasta following the included recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Counts

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We use it to ground pork primarily and it works great. We do freeze the pork a little and then cut into small pieces before grounding. Because it is mostly plastic, no rust and easy to clean. I am glad that I did not spend a fortune on the electric models. No more costly ground pork from local grocery stores.
customer_reviews.author: VTMOM

customer_reviews.title: Simple and useful.
customer_reviews.text: It is a very simple thing to use and there is very little effort required in turning the grinder. After washing it, be sure to put the blade back in the correct way or it will not work. Otherwise, this product is excellent and I've had no problems with it at all. It does exactly what it is supposed to do and does it very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mario V

customer_reviews.title: It Arrived Fast
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to use it yet but it came really fast even for it being shipped to a APO over seas. If I can figure out how to do a update on my review at a later date I will let ya all know more. One thing I did test out was the suction. It does not move after you suction it down to the counter which is a major plus. :)
customer_reviews.author: Becckai

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Mincer~!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once to grind up some chicken thighs...Worked GREAT! ...I followed some other tips that I read, and ran partially frozen meat through it so that it wouldn't just smoosh....and that was a GREAT tip....my chicken burgers came out amazing...but next time I will use the smaller holed plate.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: it was a great product before it broke
customer_reviews.text: it was a great product before it broke. It last several months and then one of the plastic piece broke.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Work great, but not as well as I thought, you have to cut the meat a lot smaller.
customer_reviews.author: 777hp-Honda

customer_reviews.title: NoPro Meat Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Despite its size and moderate price, this tool does its job well. First thing I learned was to read the directions! It's easy to put it together wrong - and that doesn't work. The cutter heads do a good job on pork and beef, and I even tried mixing meats and spices together for sausage. Worked like a charm! Very good for medium duty kitchen chores.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Mike Foley

product_meta.title: Norpro Meat Grinder, Mincer and Pasta Maker
product_meta.description:
Size:One SizeMeasures: 7" x 4.75" x 4" / 18cm x 12cm x 10cm
A must have for the kitchen! Mince and grind meat or make pasta all with one machine! Ideal for meats, beans, nuts and vegetables. Comes with two screens; coarse mincing plate and fine mincing plate. Perfect for making fresh ground beef for burgers and meatloaf and home-made sausage. Also great for grinding chicken, turkey, pork, fish, London broil, short ribs, venison and much more. Features FIVE pasta attachments; Penne, Tagliatelle/Fettuccine, Fusilli/Spiral, Rigatoni & Spaghetti. Enjoy your favorite homemade pasta from your own kitchen! Includes a sausage funnel and stainless steel blades. Suction base and locking key securely suctions to your smooth countertop or work space. Easy to assemble, use and clean. Recipe and instruction booklet included.

 Norpro was founded in 1973 with a vision to design, manufacture, and supply the highest caliber kitchenware. Norpro’s offering of innovative, high quality product for cooking, preparing and serving food are produced with superior materials and craftsmanship.



AMAZON.COM
Norpro’s meat grinder/mincer/pasta maker combines the functionality of three kitchen gadgets in one. Crush beans, vegetables and nuts for spreads and pâté; grind beef chuck, round or sirloin for incredible homemade hamburgers; pulverize stale bread for breadcrumbs; or break up veggies for baby food. The possibilities are endless thanks to coarse- and fine-textured steel mincing plates. 

 Three pasta attachments open up a world of Italian cuisine, enabling cooks to create fresh homemade rigatoni, spaghetti, or linguine. Plus, an enclosed funnel makes grinding sausage a snap. Also included are a suction-locking pestle, plastic tray, detailed instructions, and a recipe booklet. The unit stands 7 inches high with a 4-1/4 inch diameter base. This kitchen tool is FDA-approved. --Mary Park
feature_bullets: A must have for the kitchen! Mince and grind meat or make pasta all with one machine! Ideal for meats, beans, nuts and vegetables.

Comes with two screens; coarse mincing plate and fine mincing plate. Perfect for making fresh ground beef for burgers and meatloaf and home-made sausage. Also great for grinding chicken, turkey, pork, fish, London broil, short ribs, venison and much more.
Features FIVE pasta attachments; Penne, Tagliatelle/Fettuccine, Fusilli/Spiral, Rigatoni & Spaghetti. Enjoy your favorite homemade pasta from your own kitchen!
Includes a sausage funnel and stainless steel blades. Suction base and locking key securely suctions to your smooth countertop or work space.
